cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: in the Gulf of Gonave, about 35 mi NNE of Tiburon, Haiti
cyclone.trajectory: Matthew is expected to turn north-northwest, then northwest, moving through the Bahamas and then tracking just offshore the east coast of Florida toward Georgia/South Carolina.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: possible coastal encounter near Cape Canaveral / east-central Florida coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Deerfield Beach to the Volusia/Brevard county line; Tropical Storm Watch from Seven Mile Bridge northward to south of Deerfield Beach including Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warnings for Haiti, eastern Cuba, and the Bahamas; no warnings yet for Florida
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Bahamas and Florida’s Atlantic coast from the Keys northward into Georgia
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible late Thursday into Friday as Matthew passes east of the peninsula.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Only minor water rises (<3 ft) expected along the west-central Florida coast owing to offshore track.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible as outer rainbands sweep across the peninsula.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and hazardous marine conditions in Tampa Bay and approaches, causing potential port operation delays.
